column4: i have a linksys router with some firmware in the form of a .bin file what do i do
just recently got it
I would goto linksys's website for that
what should i go there for? i got the firmware from their site but  found no instructions
im quite new to ubuntu
but ubuntu has NOTHIGN to do with upgrading your router's firmware
well ive yet to even get it working yet
i was running a hub, and now i bought a router, but i can no longer get online
this is my first experience with a router also
That's not a question for this channel, that is a question for linksys or router people, that's what I was saying
yes but there is a interaction with ubuntu and the router in order for it to work
but the router came with a bunch of .exe installation files, so i went to their site and got the files in .bin form
now i should extract/install something from the .bin on ubuntu right

no, if you are connecting to your router with ubuntu via an ethernet cable it has nothing to do with ubuntu, same as if you were using windows. Installing firmware is normally done via the web control panel on your router, you should get out your router instruction manual or download it from linksys and look up how to update firmware
well what i am really wondering is how i can configure my router via ubuntu
via your browser JUST like in windows, totally OS  agnostic
how do you suggest i get a connection from my modem to my router
by following your ISP's, modem's and routers manuals
did i insult you or something?

no I'm trying to tell you that this is an ubuntu os channel, and you are asking router and modem configuration questions, Ubuntu can connect to your router (if it's setup correctly) via ethernet, just like any other OS
so do you know of any router/modem irc rooms around that could help me due to my superb ignorance on this subject?
your best bet is honestly the manuals for your equipement and help from your ISP, it will get done faster if you call them
